column4: hi im back, im booted into persistant ubuntu but its not letting me move the partition?
you said resize before, not move
if you want you can expand partitions, and contract them, but you can't pick them up and move them to a different part of the disk
my original post said move, do i have a problem?
seems that it will only let me move right to left?
if you have something like
a partition A, then empty space, then partition B, then more space
you can expand A to the right or B to left
thats what i have?
but you can't swamp A and B's places
this is entirely a contrived example
how do i know what your partition layout looks like?
my partition layout is as, devsda1,devsda3,devsda5(files system),devsda6swap : i want to move devsda3 to devsda5?
is there noway i can do this?
there are ways, possibly, but they're all complex and involve backing up your files elsewhere, deleting partitions and recreating them, and moving files back onto them
this sucks surely i should just be able to expand over ?
please state exactly what you want to do
as of the table i have 10 gigs of space(sda3)deleted formated whatever, i want to put this into sda5 and kill sda3
so that sda5 is 10 gigs bigger
and there is an sda4 in the middle?
no sda4
